alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 31 at 1:50PM MST until January 01 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST SATURDAY ABOVE 6000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow above 6000 feet. Snow showers will increase through the afternoon and evening, becoming steady overnight. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches, with higher amounts of 8 to 12 inches above 7500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph, leading to reduced visibility in areas of blowing snow. * WHERE...Areas above 6000 feet near Buffalo Pass, Ganado and Window Rock. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute, as well as any New Year`s Eve travel plans. Additional snow forecast from 1 PM Today to 11 AM Saturday: Buffalo Pass 6 to 10 inches Ganado 2 to 4 inches Window Rock 1 to 3 inches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
